messages.message: anyone out there still using the OCR app? Now that we have “Reader” I am looking to remove it.
i think it’s still the default app when you click on an ibdoc from File Explorer?
yes, but that can be changed to Reader I believe
OCR app is just far behind on things and would be easier to put it out to pasture
@Travis thanks for bringing this up! There is one minor item we need to do which is to enable ibmsg support in Reader. We can target 22.09 minor release to start with. cc: @Kerry @Aayush
OCR app also is using the old IBDocViewer which would be great to get very close to removing also
File explorer and OCR app are the last two to use the old DocViewer

I am not sure if we can use reader for the OCR app :thinking_face: for example, if you have an ibdoc / ibmsg that has refined phrases, can the reader app show it? the OCR app is just a viewer / read-only UI for a ibdoc file. I think flow review is closer to reader for doing so (i’m supportive of getting rid of it, but i’m not sure if reader is the replacement)
I’ll look at the OCR app at some point and see what options we have
if we can re-use Flow Review then perhaps upgrading OCR app will be the path forward.
The raw view in the OCR app is super important!
So whatever we move to should support that
@lydia the raw view you can also access by right clicking on a ibdoc / ibmsg and then choose Preview :stuck_out_tongue:
